nio/IntelMraaInterruptGpio.description: Use Intel's libmraa to handle gpio interrupts from the IO on Galileo, Edison & other platforms.

mraa_gpio_pin.title: Mraa Pin #
mraa_gpio_pin.description: The Mraa pin number. For Edison, see pin number mappings [here](https://github.com/intel-iot-devkit/mraa/blob/master/docs/edison.md)

nio/IntelMraaReadGpio.description: Use Intel's libmraa to read the IO on Galileo, Edison & other platforms. Reads are driven by input signals.

mraa_gpio_pin.title: Mraa Pin #
mraa_gpio_pin.description: The Mraa pin number. For Edison, see pin number mappings [here](https://github.com/intel-iot-devkit/mraa/blob/master/docs/edison.md)

default.description: Any list of signals. One read will be made per input signal.
Each input signal is output with the added attribute `pin`, which is the value read from the specified pin.

nio/IntelMraaWriteGpio.description: Use Intel's libmraa to write to the IO on Galileo, Edison & other platforms.

mraa_gpio_pin.title: Mraa Pin #
mraa_gpio_pin.description: The Mraa pin number. For Edison, see pin number mappings [here](https://github.com/intel-iot-devkit/mraa/blob/master/docs/edison.md)

value.title: Pin Value
value.description: The value to write to the specified **mraa_pin_#**. Regular boolean interpretation is done here except the string '0' is treated as `False`.

default.description: Any list of signals. One write will be made per a signal.
Each input signal is output with the added attribute `write_status` which is the status value returned by the pin write.
